meanings.definition: Slightly sharp or bitter in taste
meanings.sent1: The subacrid flavor of the lemon made her pucker her lips.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a subacrid touch of vinegar to the salad dressing.
meanings.sent3: The subacrid taste of the medicine made him cringe but he knew it would help him feel better.
meanings.sent4: The subacrid aftertaste of the coffee lingered on her tongue long after she finished her cup.
meanings.sent5: The subacrid taste of the unripe apple was a sharp contrast to the sweetness of the ripe ones.

meanings.definition: Having a slightly sharp or bitter smell
meanings.sent1: The subacrid scent of burnt popcorn filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The subacrid odor of the cleaning solution made her cough.
meanings.sent3: The subacrid smell of the garbage made him hold his nose as he took it out.
meanings.sent4: The subacrid aroma of the flowers was not as pleasant as she had hoped.
meanings.sent5: The subacrid smell of the smoke from the bonfire clung to their clothes long after the party ended.

meanings.definition: Showing a slight sharpness or bitterness in behavior or tone
meanings.sent1: Her subacrid remarks left a sour atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent2: The subacrid tone of his voice made it clear he was not pleased.
meanings.sent3: Despite her subacrid words, he knew she was just having a bad day.
meanings.sent4: The subacrid attitude of the customer made the waiter's job more challenging.
meanings.sent5: His subacrid response to her question caught her off guard.
